question: When is the protein OAS1 activated?
ideal_answer: OAS1 is a IFN-stimulated gene. Antiviral response.

snippets.text: encodes antiviral restriction enzyme activators (OAS1, OAS2 and OAS3)
interferon-stimulating genes (ISG15, IFI6, IFI27, IFI44, and OAS1)
IFN-stimulated genes (ISGs: ISG56, OAS1, MxA, and Mx2)
OASs play critical roles in immune response against virus infection by polymerizing ATP into 2-5As, which initiate the classical OAS/RNase L pathway and induce degradation of viral RNA.
OAS1 gene in activation of innate immune response
